alert.note: Alert for Davidson; Montgomery; Moore; Randolph; Stanly (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 08 at 3:55PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central North Carolina, including the following counties, Davidson, Montgomery, Moore, Randolph and Stanly. * WHEN...Until 900 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 355 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Albemarle, Troy, Carthage, North Carolina Zoo, Badin Lake, Biscoe, Seagrove, Badin, Robbins, Star, Richfield, New London, Steeds, Eldorado, Martha, Whip-O-Will Campground, Pinehaven Marina, Fish Tales Marina, Morrow Mountain State Park and Lake Tillery. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
